title: Bug 6009 - New class wizard doesn't get context right for nested classes
description: When using the new class wizard in the IDE, the context for nested classes is not correctly populated.
OB: When using the new class wizard in the IDE, the field for 'Enclosing Type' is blank.
EB: When using the new class wizard in the IDE, the field for 'Enclosing Type' should default to the current type in the editor.
SR:
To reproduce this issue: 
1. Open the IDE and open a .java file in the editor. 
2. Click on the new class button. 
3. Check the 'Enclosing Type' field in the new class wizard. It should be blank when it should default to the current type in the editor.
